clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Plasma Exchange Compared to Standard Medical Therapy in Patients With Severe Drug Induced Liver Injury With or Without Underlying Chronic Liver Disease.
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial to Study the Efficacy and Safety of Plasma Exchange Compared to Standard Medical Therapy in Patients With Severe Drug Induced Liver Injury With or Without Underlying Chronic Liver Disease.

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, India

clinical_study.source: Institute of Liver and Biliary Sciences, India

brief_summary.textblock: In this randomized study subject will be randomized into two groups Group A will receive Standard Medical Treatment (Albumin + High Caloric Diet) Group B will continue Standard Medical Treatment with High Volume Plasma Exchange. All other interventions will be at the discretion of clinicians.

primary_outcome.measure: Transplant free survival in both group

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with the development of organ dysfunction or failure in both group

arm_group.arm_group_label: High Volume Plasma Exchange with SMT
arm_group.description: PLASMA EXCHANGE is therapeutic procedure in which blood of the patient is passed through a medical device which separates plasma from other components of blood. The plasma is removed and replaced with a replacement solution such as colloid solution (e.g., albumin and/or plasma) or a combination of crystalloid/colloid solution.Plasma exchange leads to removal of abnormal circulating plasma factor or a physiologic factor produced in excess (IG, NH3,protein bond toxins )and also exert a immunomodulatory activity. criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age-18-70 years
- Preferably Biopsy proven or history suggestive of DILI (Drug Induced Liver Injury)
1. Grade IV DILI With T.B > 15
2. DILI Manifesting as ACLF (Acute on chronic Liver failure) /ALF (Acute Liver Failure) with no transplant option
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence of active infection
- Refusal of consent or assent
- Patients with clinical suspicion of irreversible brain injury
- Pregnancy
- HCC (Hepatocellular Carcinoma) or any other malignancy
- Kidney failure
- Portal vein thrombosis
- Upper GastroIntestinal bleed
- Transplant
